result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick J. Carroll was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court has no objection to early discharge after 1 year if Agent feels defendant has completed probation successfully.
Concurrent with: with 15CF217.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment and/or full time student status or a combination of both.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages.
Defendant shall have no contact directly or indirectly with David Leitner.
Defendant shall have no contact directly or indirectly with Cody Petrausch unless approved by  Agent.
Defendant's record shall be expunged per Section 973.015 Wis Stats if probation is successfully completed.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Defendant granted huber privileges.
Concurrent with: with 15CF217 and any other sentence.
